name: MEsc Software Engineering
description: Candidate for the Masters of Engineering Science in Software Engineering at the University of Western Ontario. Recipient of the Ontario Graduate Scholarship.

name: BEsc Software Engineering
description: Graduated with Distinction in Software Engineering from the University of Western Ontario. Achieved Dean’s Honor List and the Western Scholarship of Excellence.

name: High School Diploma
description: Graduated from Bayview Glen Independent School in Toronto.

name: Thesis Research
description: Conducted penetration testing on open-source EV charging infrastructure. Developed a Docker-based virtual testbed using the EVerest framework, executed multi-threaded DoS attacks with Bash and Python, and implemented ML-based intrusion detection models.

name: Research Project
description: Using Supervised Machine Learning in an SDN Edge-Controlled IoT Network for Anomaly Detection and Mitigation. Authored the introduction, led a team of five, and designed a detailed presentation to communicate research findings.

name: Teaching Assistantship
description: Teaching Assistant at the University of Western Ontario. Facilitated lab sessions and mentored students in software design, full-stack web development, AWS deployment, JavaFX, and UML design.

projects.title: Software Design (Winter 2024)
projects.description: Facilitated lab sessions, graded assignments, and taught UML, JavaFX, and core software design principles.

projects.title: Web Technologies (Fall 2023)
projects.description: Guided full-stack web development labs, assisted with AWS deployment, and managed student engagement via Discord.

name: Hyperpad (Startup) Software Engineer
description: At Hyperpad, I onboarded and mentored new hires, teaching Git CLI workflows, pull request rebasing, and clean code practices. I collaborated with UI/UX designers to develop polished, user-focused frontend features, while also building backend services using GraphQL, Ruby on Rails, and Firebase to enhance performance and scalability. I automated grant workflows with Playwright bots to improve operational efficiency, and created robust end-to-end tests using Cypress, Detox, and Cucumber to ensure software quality. Additionally, I delivered responsive frontend components with React.js, HTML/CSS, and Next.js in an Agile development environment.

name: Sailor Dash
description: A game developed during high school that demonstrated early programming skills and creativity.

name: Val-T
description: Val-T is an online platform for organizing and hosting Valorant tournaments...

name: HIVE
description: I worked on both the frontend and the backend development for this project. This included implementing design features, authenticating users through firebase and integrating their github account, creating a sample json file for dummy data and accessing it using express, and grabbing necessary information from Github using the Github API. It was a lot of work to get done alone but I'm proud of what I was able to develop for the demo in a short period of time.

name: RiSync
description: I worked on the UI/UX Design, built the Front-End Code, deployed the project to Google Cloud, and incorporated the Google API's :) I Enjoyed working 23 hours straight to produce something I can be proud of!

name: Travel Buddy
description: I worked on back end development with American Airlines' Flight Engine API. This was my first time working on back end development. I also contributed to the Unity Game Scene Navigation with no experience in C# or the Unity Interface.

name: WeGrowth
description: With no C++ experience, I was able to take Felicia's amazing design's and incorporate them into the game. I worked on incorporating the sprite image, background image, and icons. I also sourced and incorporated sounds in the game.

name: Spacetagram
description: A React-based web app that pulls data from NASA’s Astronomy Picture of the Day API to display space photography with like functionality.
